bind.jr:constraintMsg: You must have at least one stratigraphic layer!
The bottom depth cannot be less than or equal to the top depth

input.label: Enter a number or name for this profile
Enter the survey block number (if any)

select.label: Select all the personnel who recorded this site or feature.

group.label: Enter specifics of “other” in the following categories:

select.label: Select all the types of surface disturbances that may be present.
Select all groundcover conditions for the site or feature.
Select the range of slopes present at the surface
Select the types of geomorphological settings present at the site or feature.

group.label: Enter specifics of “other” in the following categories:
Collect spatial information about the site or feature.

input.label: Record a datum waypoint for the profile.
Enter the GPS elevation at the top of the profile.

group.label: Enter general information about the stratigraphy

input.label: How many stratigraphic layers are present?
General notes about the profile and locale.

upload.label: Draw a general sketch of the profile.
Take an overview photo of the profile

input.label: Depth below surface of top of stratum (m)
Depth below surface of bottom of stratum (m)

select.label: Select all characteristics that apply to the stratum

item.label: Root casts or rotted plant roots present.
Evidence of insect or worm activity

select1.label: Choose the appropriate designation for the mixture of fines in the matrix

item.label: Sandy silt (mostly silt, with 50% or less sands)
Silty sand (mostly sand, with 50% or less silts)
Clayey sand (mostly sand with 50% or less clays)
Sandy clay (mostly clay with 50% or less sands)
Silty clay (mostly silt with 50% or less clays)
Clayey silt (mostly clay with 50% or less silt)
Loam (generally even mixture of sand, silt, and clay)

select1.label: Select the sorting of the matrix

select.label: Select all characteristics that apply to the clasts

select1.label: Select the sorting of the clasts

select.label: Select the strength of carbonate encrustation

item.label: Very weak carbonate formation on clasts (faint white film)
Weak carbonate formation on clasts (thin undercoating)
Moderate carbonate formation on clasts (thick undercoating)
Strong carbonate formation on clasts (partial cementation)
Very strong carbonate formation on clasts (total cementation)

select.label: Size of sand grains (use chart to estimate)
Roundness of sand grains (use chart to estimate)
Sphericity of sands (use chart to estimate)
Size of gravels (use chart to estimate)
Roundness of gravels (use chart to estimate)
Sphericity of gravels (use chart to estimate)
Size of pebbles (use chart to estimate)
Roundness of pebbles (use chart to estimate)
Sphericity of pebbles (use chart to estimate)
Size of cobbles (use chart to estimate)
Roundness of cobbles (use chart to estimate)
Sphericty of cobbles (use chart to estimate)
Size of boulders (use chart to estimate)
Roundness of boulder (use chart to estimate)
Sphericity of boulders (use chart to estimate)

select1.label: Select the most likely depositional environment of the stratum.
Is there any soil development present in the stratum?

select.label: Select all soil horizons present
Select all soil characteristics present

item.label: Accumulation of Fe and Al oxides
Illuvial organic matter and Fe and Al oxides
Distinctive color or structure without clay accumulation

select.label: Select the ped structure of the soils

item.label: Prismatic (flat or rounded faces, longer vertically)
Columnar (like prismatic, but longer and distinct tops)
Indeterminate (difficult to asses the ped strucure)

select.label: Select the sizes of the ped structures (use size guides in Munsell book)
Select the strength of soil development

input.label: Enter the Munsell color code of the soil.

select1.label: Select the soil type that best describes this soil.

item.label: Entisol (very young soil, OA horizon only)
Inceptisol (young soil, B horizon just evident)
Oxisol (highly developed soil, many clays, often in tropics)
Vertisol (Also grassland, but with large columnar peds)

input.label: Write any additional notes about the soils in this layer.
How many samples were taken from this profile?

group.label: Enter information about sample taken from this layer.

input.label: Depth below surface of bottom of sample (m)
Name/designation of the stratagraphic unit from which the sample comes.
